item.title: Tres
item.description: Shortcodes Este el tercer blog. See https://gohugo.io/content-management/shortcodes/#use-hugos-built-in-shortcodes I guess I can use Org mode hyperlinks style: [[https://gohugo.io/content-management/shortcodes/#use-hugos-built-in-shortcodes][Shortcodes]] No! I am not in Org-mode but Markdown. So, I should use MD syntax: Shortcodes Molecular Electron Density, MP2

item.title: My Second Post
item.description: Hello, Teje. This is my second blog. It seems rather easy to create blogs; just hugo new post/name_of-the_blog.md

item.title: My First Post
item.description: Example of code snippet PROGRAM MAIN IMPLICIT NONE STOP 0 END PROGRAM MAIN Teje, can I write TCL snippets? # How about TCL? puts stderr "Hello Teje" Lists Bullet list: Start a line with an asterisk Food Fruits Oranges Apples Numbered list: One Two Three Tables Tables aren’t part of the core Markdown spec, but they are part of GFM and Markdown Here supports them.
